yawning_titan.config.agents.blue_agent_config.BlueAgentConfig

class yawning_titan.config.agents.blue_agent_config.BlueAgentConfig(_max_number_deceptive_nodes: int, _can_discover_failed_attacks: bool, _chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion: float, _chance_to_discover_intrusion_on_scan: float, _chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion_deceptive_node: float, _chance_to_discover_intrusion_on_scan_deceptive_node: float, _chance_to_discover_failed_attack: float, _can_discover_succeeded_attacks_if_compromise_is_discovered: bool, _can_discover_succeeded_attacks_if_compromise_is_not_discovered: bool, _chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_compromise_known: float, _chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_compromise_not_known: float, _chance_to_discover_failed_attack_deceptive_node: float, _chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_deceptive_node: float, _making_node_safe_modifies_vulnerability: bool, _vulnerability_change_during_node_patch: float, _making_node_safe_gives_random_vulnerability: bool, _blue_uses_reduce_vulnerability: bool, _blue_uses_restore_node: bool, _blue_uses_make_node_safe: bool, _blue_uses_scan: bool, _blue_uses_isolate_node: bool, _blue_uses_reconnect_node: bool, _blue_uses_do_nothing: bool, _blue_uses_deceptive_nodes: bool, _relocating_deceptive_nodes_generates_a_new_node: bool)[source]

Bases: ConfigABC

Class that validates and stores the Blue Agent Configuration.

Notes from the DSTL

The blue agent does not have to have perfect detection. In these settings you can change how much information blue can gain from the red agents actions. There are two different pieces of information blue can get: intrusions and attacks.

Intrusions

An intrusion is when the red agent takes over a node and compromises it. You can change the chance that blue has to be able to detect this using the “chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion”. If blue does not detect an intrusion then it can use the scan action to try and discover these intrusions with are used as detectors to inform blue when they are compromised. They should have a chance to detect of 1 so that they can detect everything (at the very least they should have a chance to detect higher than the normal chance to detect) but you can modify it if you so wish with “chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion_deceptive_node” and “chance_to_discover_intrusion_on_scan_deceptive_node”.

Attacks

Attacks are the actual attacks that the red agent does to compromise the nodes. For example you may be able to see that node 14 is compromised but using the attack detection, the blue agent may be able to see that it was node 12 that attacked node 14. You can modify the chance for blue to see attacks that failed, succeeded ( and blue was able to detect that the node was compromised) and attacks that succeeded and the blue agent did not detect the intrusion.

Again there are settings to change the likelihood that a deceptive node can detect an attack. While this should remain at 1, it is open for you to change.

Methods

create

Creates an instance of BlueAgentConfig after calling .validate.

to_dict

Serializes a ConfigABC as a dict.

validate

Validates the blue agent config dict.

Attributes

blue_uses_deceptive_nodes

Blue agent can place down deceptive nodes.

blue_uses_do_nothing

Blue agent does nothing.

blue_uses_isolate_node

Blue disables all the connections to and from a node.

blue_uses_make_node_safe

Blue fixes a node but does not restore it to its initial state.

blue_uses_reconnect_node

Blue re-connects all the connections to and from a node.

blue_uses_reduce_vulnerability

Blue picks a node and reduces the vulnerability score.

blue_uses_restore_node

Blue picks a node and restores everything about the node to its starting state.

blue_uses_scan

Blue scans all the nodes to try and detect any red intrusions.

can_discover_failed_attacks

Can discover the location an attack came from if the attack failed.

can_discover_succeeded_attacks_if_compromise_is_discovered

Can blue learn information about an attack that succeeds if the compromise is known.

can_discover_succeeded_attacks_if_compromise_is_not_discovered

Can blue learn information about an attack that succeeds if the compromise is NOT known.

chance_to_discover_failed_attack

Chance for blue to discover information about a failed attack.

chance_to_discover_failed_attack_deceptive_node

Chance to discover the location of a failed attack on a deceptive node.

chance_to_discover_intrusion_on_scan

When blue performs the scan action this is the chance that a red intrusion is discovered.

chance_to_discover_intrusion_on_scan_deceptive_node

When blue uses the scan action what is the chance that blue will detect an intrusion in a deceptive node.

chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_compromise_known

Chance for blue to discover information about an attack that succeeded and the compromise was known.

chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_compromise_not_known

Chance for blue to discover information about an attack that succeeded and the compromise was NOT known.

chance_to_discover_succeeded_attack_deceptive_node

Chance to discover the location of a succeeded attack against a deceptive node.

chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion

Chance for blue to discover a node that red has compromised the instant red compromises the node.

chance_to_immediately_discover_intrusion_deceptive_node

Chance for blue to discover a deceptive node that red has compromised the instant it is compromised.

making_node_safe_gives_random_vulnerability

When fixing a node the vulnerability score is randomised.

making_node_safe_modifies_vulnerability

If blue fixes a node then the vulnerability score of that node increases.

max_number_deceptive_nodes

The max number of deceptive nodes that blue can place.

relocating_deceptive_nodes_generates_a_new_node

Relocating deceptive nodes generates a new node.

vulnerability_change_during_node_patch

The amount that the vulnerability of a node changes when it is made safe.

to_dict() → Dict

Serializes a ConfigABC as a dict.

As instances of ConfigABC are dataclasses, the default __dict__ method is used to access the attributes. The private key name of each attribute has its underscore prefix removed before the key and value is added to a dict and returned.

Returns

The ConfigABC as a dict.

Blue re-connects all the connections to and from a node.

property blue_uses_do_nothing: bool

Blue agent does nothing.

property blue_uses_deceptive_nodes: bool

Blue agent can place down deceptive nodes.

These nodes act as just another node in the network but have a different chance of spotting attacks and always show when they are compromised.

property relocating_deceptive_nodes_generates_a_new_node

Relocating deceptive nodes generates a new node.

When the blue agent places a deceptive node and it has none left in stock it will “pick up” the first deceptive node that it used and “relocate it” When relocating a node will the stats for the node ( such as the vulnerability and compromised status) be re-generated as if adding a new node or will they carry over from the “old” node.
